metadata.title: CVE-2013-3565 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the HTTP Interfacein VideoLAN VLC Media Player before 2.0.7 allow remote attackers to injectarbitrary web script or HTML via the (1) command parameter torequests/vlm_cmd.xml, (2) dir parameter to requests/browse.xml, or (3) URIin a request, which is returned in an error message throughshare/lua/intf/http.lua.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-3565` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc5 - 2.1.2-2build2
libvlccore7 - 2.1.2-2build2
vlc - 2.1.2-2build2
vlc-data - 2.1.2-2build2
vlc-nox - 2.1.2-2build2
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 2.1.2-2build2
vlc-plugin-jack - 2.1.2-2build2
vlc-plugin-notify - 2.1.2-2build2
vlc-plugin-pulse - 2.1.2-2build2
vlc-plugin-sdl - 2.1.2-2build2
vlc-plugin-svg - 2.1.2-2build2
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 2.1.2-2build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-2build2').
